My DevOps Story

by
Shivaraj Nesaragi

Being a Computer Science Graduate Student,it's one of the necessity to comprehend DevOps. The Software World is fast driven and it has become mandatory to satisfy customers in a definitive short span. I was thrilled when NYU introduced DevOps course for the first time and I instantly made up my mind to enroll for this course.

I really hope to make most out of the course and since I never worked on Testing tools as much as I intended to, I wish to learn more about Testing in this course as well as to comprehed entire architecture of DevOps by the end of this semester.

Weekly Updates:

  • Week 11: Working on test scripts in Jenkins for checking the recently commited files to the github.
  • Week 10: Integrated slack with the Jenkins and working on creating scripts to use html checker and url checker in Jenkins.
  • Week 9: Working on running the html checker and url scripts on Jenkins
  • Week 8: Integrated Jenkins with the Github repository of mine and tested various scenarios such as multiple commits,commits from different users etc.
  • Week 7: Working on Jenkins on Amazon cloud server
  • Week 6: Installed Jenkins on local machine as well as on Amazon cloud server to check its operations with a test github repository
  • Week 5: Researching on installation of Jenkins on local machine as well as on the server
  • Week 4: Picking the right tool for testing, researching more on Jenkins
  • Week 3: Reading chapter 1 of the book Infrastructure as Code: Managing Servers in the Cloud by Kief Morris
  • Week 2: Researching on Jenkins tool and creating a html listing it's important features.
  • Week 1: Writing up my journal.
